宛先アドレス: (あてさきアドレス) - destination address
宛名書き: (あてながき) - addressing (e.g. writing an address on an envelope)
宛字: (あてじ) - kanji used as a phonetic symbol, instead of for the meaning/phonetic-equivalent character/substitute character; kanji used for their meaning, irrespective of reading
宛然: (えんぜん) - as if; the very thing itself
宜い: (よい) - (also いい (all senses)) good/excellent/fine/nice/pleasant/agreeable; sufficient (can be used to turn down an offer)/ready/prepared; profitable (e.g. deal, business offer, etc.)/beneficial; OK
宜しい: (yoroshii) - bom, ok, tudo bem, certo, muito bem, farei, pode, consegue
宜しかったら: (よろしかったら) - if you don't mind; if you like
宜しきを得る: (よろしきをえる) - just about right; quite appropriate
宜しく: (yoroshiku) - bem, adequadamente, de forma apropriada; melhores cumprimentos, lembre-se de mim, por favor me trate favoravelmente, cuide de mim, por favor faça; assim como ..., como se alguém fosse ...; de todas as formas, claro
宜しくお願いします: (よろしくおねがいします) - please remember me; please help me; please treat me well; I look forward to working with you
宜しくお願い致します: (よろしくおねがいいたします) - please remember me; please help me; please treat me well
宜しくやる: (よろしくやる) - to make out with/to make cozy with (cosy); to do at one's own discretion
宜しければ: (よろしければ) - if you please; if you don't mind; when you're ready; if you want; if that's alright with you
宜しゅう: (よろしゅう) - best regards; please remember me; please treat me favorably (favourably); please take care of
宜なるかな: (うべなるかな) - quite right; indeed; truly; well said
宜敷く: (よろしく) - (夜露死苦 is slang) well/properly/suitably; best regards/please remember me/please treat me favorably (favourably)/please take care of; (as ...よろしく) just like .../as though one were ...; (as よろしく…べし) by all means/of course
宜陽殿: (ぎようでん) - pavilion housing imperial treasures and historical artifacts (in Heian Palace)
宝さかって入る時はさかって出る: (たからさかっているときはさかってでる) - ill-gotten gains fade as fast as they were obtained
宝さがし: (たからさがし) - treasure hunting; lucky dip/game involving finding hidden prizes from a sand box, barrel of leaves, etc.
宝づくし: (たからづくし) - collection of treasures/collection of luck-bringing items; pattern with drawings of several lucky items
宝の山に入りながら手を空しくして帰る: (たからのやまにいりながらてをむなしくしてかえる) - (proverb) though sitting on a pile of riches, one comes back empty handed; to have a good opportunity only to let it slip from your grasp
宝の持ち腐れ: (たからのもちぐされ) - pearls thrown before swine; unused possession; useless possession; waste of talent
宝は湧き物: (たからはわきもの) - from riches spring riches; those who seek riches find riches
宝もの: (たからもの) - treasure; treasured item; prized possession
宝丹: (ほうたん) - type of smelling salts sold in the late Edo period
宝位: (ほうい) - rank of the emperor; the imperial throne
宝倉: (ほくら) - (ほくら only)  small shrine; depository for sacred objects
宝典: (ほうてん) - precious book; handbook; thesaurus; treasury of words
宝冠大綬章: (ほうかんだいじゅしょう) - Grand Cordon of the Order of the Precious Crown
宝冠杏葉章: (ほうかんきょうようしょう) - Order of the Precious Crown, Apricot
宝冠波光章: (ほうかんはこうしょう) - Order of the Precious Crown, Ripple
宝冠牡丹章: (ほうかんぼたんしょう) - Order of the Precious Crown, Peony
宝冠白蝶章: (ほうかんしろちょうしょう) - Order of the Precious Crown, Butterfly
宝冠章: (ほうかんしょう) - Orders of the Precious Crown; Orders of the Sacred Crown
宝冠藤花章: (ほうかんとうかしょう) - Order of the Precious Crown, Wistaria
宝号: (ほうごう) - name (of a buddha or bodhisattva)
宝器: (ほうき) - treasured article or vessel; outstanding individual
宝字: (ほうじ) - kanji for "takara" (impressed on the obverse of a coin)
宝尽くし: (たからづくし) - collection of treasures/collection of luck-bringing items; pattern with drawings of several lucky items
宝尽し: (たからづくし) - collection of treasures/collection of luck-bringing items; pattern with drawings of several lucky items
宝捜し: (たからさがし) - treasure hunting; lucky dip/game involving finding hidden prizes from a sand box, barrel of leaves, etc.
宝探し: (たからさがし) - treasure hunting; lucky dip/game involving finding hidden prizes from a sand box, barrel of leaves, etc.
宝殿: (ほうでん) - (shrine) repository or treasure house; (shrine) sanctuary
宝永小判: (ほうえいこばん) - hoei koban; koban coined during the Hōei period
宝永通宝: (ほうえいつうほう) - coin used during the Hōei period (ca. 1708)
宝物殿: (ほうもつでん) - (shrine) repository or treasure house; (shrine) sanctuary
宝珠: (ほうしゅ) - precious orb; Cintamani stone/wish-fulfilling jewel; {archit} hoju/uppermost spherical part of a pagoda finial
宝珠の玉: (ほうじゅのたま) - Cintamani stone; wish-fulfilling jewel
宝瓶: (ほうびん) - handleless Japanese tea pot
宝瓶宮: (ほうへいきゅう) - Aquarius (11th zodiacal sign); the Water Bearer; the Water Carrier
宝生: (ほうしょう) - Ratnasambhava; The Jewel-born (a dhyani-Buddha)
宝石商: (ほうせきしょう) - jeweler; gem dealer; jeweler's (jewelry) shop
宝石店: (ほうせきてん) - jewelry store; jewellery store
宝石箱: (ほうせきばこ) - jewel box (case, casket)
宝石羽太: (ホウセキハタ) - brown-spotted grouper (Epinephelus chlorostigma)
宝祚: (ほうそ) - rank of the emperor; the imperial throne
宝篋印塔: (ほうきょういんとう) - Hōkyōin pagoda; style of pagado containing Hōkyōin sutra
宝船: (たからぶね) - treasure ship; picture of a treasure ship bearing the Seven Gods of Good Fortune
宝蔵院流: (ほうぞういんりゅう) - Hozoin-ryu (school of sojutsu)
宝鑑: (ほうかん) - superb or valuable book
宝飾: (ほうしょく) - jewels and ornaments; jewelry; jewellery
実: (jitsu/mi/mino) - truth , truth, reality; sincerity, honesty, fidelity; content, substance; (good) result
実がなる: (みがなる) - to bear fruit; to produce a crop
実しやか: (まことしやか) - plausible (e.g. of a rumour); believable (e.g. of a story); specious (e.g. of an argument); credible (e.g. of a lie); looking very like the truth
実しやかに: (まことしやかに) - as if it were true; with seeming truth; plausibly
